Wine is not needed!
Open source engine re-implementation allows the game to benefit from modern computers and HD.
This installation includes Command and Conquer (fist release nicknamed "Tiberian Dawn"), Red Alert and Dune 2000.
To install movies, download the .iso here:
https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Game-Content
 Mount the images with cdemu. Be sure OpenRA has permissions to read drives. Check the tab permissions in gnome-sowftware
summary: Excellent game and implementation, maybe better than original

description:
OpenRA is my favourite Linux RTS game, 0 A.D. is a close second, but I find OpenRA simpler and more fun. It is one of closest Linux-compatible games I've found to my favourite PC game, Outlive. Outlive is more futuristic, however, but still they are somewhat similar. 

The only major limitation is that you cannot set the difficulty of the AI (i.e. your opponent in single-player mode), you just have a choice of four AIs. The default AI (Rush AI) is fairly ease to fight and never seems to use aircraft, while Normal AI uses aircraft quite frequently, but is still pretty ease to beat. I wish I could make the AI more of a challenge to fight.
summary: Best semi-modern RTS game available for Linux

description: It is my favourite RTS game, although I do see clear potential for improvement. The main area in which it can be improved is by adjusting the difficulty of the AI, although there are a few different AIs available, although these AIs do not massively differ in terms of difficulty, more in terms of their abilities (e.g. Rush AI doesn't use 'powers' like nukes, nor does it use Naval or Air units, just ground units).
summary: One of the finest RTS games available

description:
This engine is awesome, let's be easily play Red Alert from way back to this day.
Awesome, play it over LAN with my son!

Thankyou.

This is the finest free 2/2.5D RTS game there is for Linux IMO. 0 A.D. is the only rival it has for the title of best free RTS game for Linux. It has several different mods, with the main ones being remakes of early Westwood games and it is easy to obtain on virtually any Linux distro, partly because it is available in a number of distribution-agnostic package formats like: AppImage, Flatpak and Snap. 

Despite my general love of this game it is definitely not without its shortcomings. For example, there are some features missing from it -- like you cannot save a game and play it later, nor can you set the difficulty of the AI you're playing against (although you can choose from a few different AIs, but they differ more in strategy than difficulty). Likewise, it has some performance issues on larger maps and the game sometimes freezes when enough units are moving at once.
summary: Best free 2/2.5D RTS game available for Linux

Whether you come from nostalgia or not, it's a great way to enjoy the classic Westwood games with more gaming being added. It's a small but active and friendly community with a lot of contributors. Check out the forum and the Discord server if you want to get into the multiplayer scene which offers great dedicated servers to play on.

This is a really great re-implementation of the original game engines, which support modern network play (TCP/IP via local network or internet), has a better UI (no endlessly scrolling build options anymore), and far superior artificial intelligence.

It can download the game files for C&C, C&C: Red Alert and Dune 2000 automatically. There are instructions available for how to even download the original game movies, which provide a far more immersive experience.
summary: The original games with better networking, AI and user interface!

description: Pour les fans de Command & Conquer, ce openRA est génial. Bien que les graphisme d'origine ont vieilli les petites améliorations visuelle sont agréables par rapport au Alerte Rouge des années 90 ^^. Le jeux est en Anglais mais pour les fans de la première heure ce n'est pas dérangeant. L'éditeur de carte est aussi présent et fonctionne à merveille. Je recommande !
